title: Unable to fetch soft requirements/dependencies
body:
### Environment information

* `brownie` Version: 1.17.2
* Python Version: 3.8.9
* OS: osx

### What was wrong?
[PR-993](https://github.com/eth-brownie/brownie/pull/993/files) introduced a feature to allow for soft requirements when using brownie as a library (using an env variable). However, I am unable to fetch the the soft requirements using both `pip` and `poetry`


The following output occurred in a fresh virtual environment:
```bash
(venv) christiancoenen@ChrisMacBook pythonProject % pip list                 
Package    Version
---------- -------
pip        22.0.3
setuptools 57.0.0
wheel      0.36.2
(venv) christiancoenen@ChrisMacBook pythonProject % export BROWNIE_LIB=1             
(venv) christiancoenen@ChrisMacBook pythonProject % pip install eth-brownie --no-cache-dir
Collecting eth-brownie
  Downloading eth_brownie-1.17.2-py3-none-any.whl (221 kB)
     ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ 221.8/221.8 KB 63.5 MB/s eta 0:00:00
Collecting click==8.0.3
  Downloading click-8.0.3-py3-none-any.whl (97 kB)
     ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ 97.5/97.5 KB 202.4 MB/s eta 0:00:00
Collecting rlp==2.0.1
  Downloading rlp-2.0.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl (20 kB)
Collecting python-dotenv==0.16.0
  Downloading python_dotenv-0.16.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl (18 kB)
...
```
